properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms producing heavy rain this evening. A east to west line of thunderstorms is developing over the region. Very heavy rainfall is likely late this evening as these thunderstorms pass through. Some areas may see rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm. Some small hail and gusty winds are possible with some thunderstorms as well. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-11T07:24:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-11T01:27:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3196058091.2019
Area: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Water Quality Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: There has been a water line break in the Village of Foremost. There is currently water supply to the majority of the village. Water may be unsafe to drink or use. Crews are working to repair the line as quickly as possible.
Expires: 2019-09-17T16:04:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Village of Foremost, 2019-09-10T16:03:27-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6028
Area: Foremost
properties.Author: Village of Foremost

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 31 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 21 degrees Celsius are expected for the next 2 days. Hot and humid weather returns to Southwestern Ontario. A hot and humid air mass from the Southern United States will remain over the region tonight and Wednesday. Afternoon temperatures are expected to be near 30 again on Wednesday. Minimum temperatures in the low twenties tonight will provide little relief from the heat. Humidex values in the upper thirties to near 40 are likely for both days. A cold front sliding down from the north will bring this heat event to an end Wednesday night. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-11T07:59:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T22:51:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0479384817.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots are expected or occurring in the area. An area of intense thunderstorms approaching from Michigan will affect the waters of southern Lake Huron by 10 PM EDT. Wind gusts to 45 knots and hail are likely. These thunderstorms are moving towards the east at near 30 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-09-11T04:29:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-11T01:31:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1418794000.2019
Area: Southern Lake Huron
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies, light winds and near zero degree temperatures will help frost to develop tonight over the region. Temperatures are expected to rebound during the day on Wednesday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-11T13:29:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T21:30:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4217634505.2019
